column4: I'm familiar with aMsn and can spank it's coders, what's the issue?
As soon as I try to send a soundclip it gives me a reeeally annoying distortion
send? when you send soundclip it shouldn't be playing it really
Oh it doesn't, it's just when I play it up myself, or the reciever clicks it, it's like, my voice and a distinct "I just shoved the mic into the spinning fan" kind of sound
and what is your default mediaplayer that aMsn tries to invoke?
Good question, I have no clue :P
let me have a look, moment
by default it uses aplay which probably sucks ass :)
So what should I change to?
hmm, could try that built-in tcl library to see if it will help any
to be honest with all due respect to Alvaro, TCL isn't the best language to write msn in ;)
and if you type "aplay <thatfile.mp3>" or whatever you try to play in amsn, does it sound ok, or also with distortion?
i.e. type that in shell, not in amsn
